member.name: T:UmbracoExamine.BaseUmbracoIndexer

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.BaseUmbracoIndexer.CanInitialize
member.summary: Returns true if the Umbraco application is in a state that we can initialize the examine indexes

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.BaseUmbracoIndexer.ValidateDocument(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary: Ensures that the node being indexed is of a correct type and is a descendent of the parent id specified.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.BaseUmbracoIndexer.PerformIndexRebuild
member.summary: Reindexes all supported types

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.BaseUmbracoIndexer.PerformIndexAll(System.String)
member.summary: Builds an xpath statement to query against Umbraco data for the index type specified, then initiates the re-indexing of the data matched.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.BaseUmbracoIndexer.GetXDocument(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns an XDocument for the entire tree stored for the IndexType specified.
member.param: The type of data to request from the data service.
member.returns: Either the Content or Media xml. If the type is not of those specified null is returned

member.summary: Adds all nodes with the given xPath root.

member.summary: If true, the IndexingActionHandler will be run to keep the default index up to date.

member.name: P:UmbracoExamine.BaseUmbracoIndexer.SupportUnpublishedContent
member.summary: Determines if the manager will call the indexing methods when content is saved or deleted as opposed to cache being updated.

Constructor to allow for creating an indexer at runtime

member.name: F:UmbracoExamine.UmbracoContentIndexer.IndexFieldPolicies
member.summary: A type that defines the type of index for each Umbraco field (non user defined fields) Alot of standard umbraco fields shouldn't be tokenized or even indexed, just stored into lucene for retreival after searching.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.UmbracoContentIndexer.Initialize(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Set up all properties for the indexer based on configuration information specified. This will ensure that all of the folders required by the indexer are created and exist. This will also create an instruction file declaring the computer name that is part taking in the indexing. This file will then be used to determine the master indexer machine in a load balanced environment (if one exists).
member.param: The friendly name of the provider.
A collection of the name/value pairs representing the provider-specific attributes specified in the configuration for this provider.
member.exception: The name of the provider is null.
The name of the provider has a length of zero.
An attempt is made to call on a provider after the provider has already been initialized.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.UmbracoContentIndexer.OnDocumentWriting(Examine.LuceneEngine.DocumentWritingEventArgs)
member.summary: This ensures that the special __Raw_ fields are indexed

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.UmbracoContentIndexer.ReIndexNode(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.String)
member.summary: Overridden for logging

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.UmbracoContentIndexer.DeleteFromIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a node from the index.
member.remarks: When a content node is deleted, we also need to delete it's children from the index so we need to perform a custom Lucene search to find all decendents and create Delete item queues for them too.
member.param: ID of the node to delete

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.UmbracoContentIndexer.AddSingleNodeToIndex(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.String)
member.summary: Overridden for logging.

member.summary: Used to refresh the current IndexerData from the data in the DataService. This can be used if there are more properties added/removed from the database

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.UmbracoContentIndexer.OnGatheringNodeData(Examine.IndexingNodeDataEventArgs)
member.summary: Override this method to strip all html from all user fields before raising the event, then after the event ensure our special Path field is added to the collection

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.UmbracoContentIndexer.OnDuplicateFieldWarning(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Called when a duplicate field is detected in the dictionary that is getting indexed.

member.summary: Overridden to add the path property to the special fields to index

member.summary: Creates an IIndexCriteria object based on the indexSet passed in and our DataService
member.remarks: If we cannot initialize we will pass back empty indexer data since we cannot read from the database

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.UmbracoContentIndexer.GetPolicy(System.String)
member.summary: return the index policy for the field name passed in, if not found, return normal

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.UmbracoContentIndexer.ValidateDocument(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary: Ensure that the content of this node is available for indexing (i.e. don't allow protected content to be indexed when this is disabled).

member.name: P:UmbracoExamine.UmbracoContentIndexer.SupportProtectedContent
member.summary: By default this is false, if set to true then the indexer will include indexing content that is flagged as publicly protected. This property is ignored if SupportUnpublishedContent is set to true.
